meanings.def: the act of going to different parts of a building, an area, etc. to make sure that there is no trouble or crime
examples: Security guards make regular patrols at night.
on patrol a police car on patrol
The Italians flew regular patrols over the desert.
They maintain a continuous patrol of the oceans with three submarines.

meanings.def: a group of soldiers, vehicles, etc. that patrol an area
examples: Every police car and foot patrol in the area is on full alert.
One soldier was killed when his patrol was ambushed.
The highway patrol has sealed off the area.
They sent out four-man patrols to scout the area.

meanings.def: a group of about six Boy Scouts or Girl Guides / Girl Scouts that forms part of a larger group
to go around an area or a building at regular times to check that it is safe and that there is no trouble
examples: Troops patrolled the border day and night.
Guards can be seen patrolling everywhere.
